voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
How can i put this... This VN was outstanding. With the exception of leaving to go to school and work, the past 4 days I have spent almost every moment of my time playing this. When I think about it now, I probably should have made it last over a longer period of time. I finished too quickly and now I'm very much bummed out. :(

----- On to the review!

5 seperate routes. The first choice dosen't come until after the 1st opening movie which takes about 6-7 hours to get to, depending on how fast you can click and read! After that, each story is actually quite unique. I half expected each route to have the same ending but with different ways of getting there. Each route revolves around one of the five main female protagonists. In each route, you can decide which girl you'd like the story to spend the most time on.

Bonus: Whichever girl's route you pick, they will eventually become your girlfriend(s) aswell.
lol Yoru and Asa  ^^^^^

There are a couple CONS, however.
The game very much tries to emphasize the importance of the club that you are all in, and in doing so, It spends waaaaayyyyyyy to much time talking about the glider, sky, and etc. Some might say they like that aspect because it feels slightly more immerseful and gives the reader more knowledge of what the characters are talking about. Buts its my review so i say its a con. :)    Additionally, as you probably know, the voice audio is in Japenese, and the text is English. In the initial release in Japan, the game was 18+ and had alot more adult scenes. When the game became available in other countries, primarily the U.S., a clean version was submitted as the only version for purchase. In doing so there are some points in a couple of the routes (Ageha's.....) where any text that anything to do with sex was replaced with filler" and alot of this filler makes literally no sense. There are times where 10-15 minutes of text will make absolutely no sense to you because its all been destroyed by translation and nonsense. Alot of engrish lol


In the wider scope of things
date:
those things didnt really matter to me in the end. I absolutely loved the story and each character had tons of emotion put into them and it did an exceptional job of immersing me into each moment. I love this game to death    10/10 would definitely play again


"

Here's my thoughts on If My Heart Had Wings"

[Story]
The story is decent but certain elements are a bit long winded. There is a lot of detail pertaining to glider construction and operation

voteText: these two elements work well together to create a unique story. The individual character story arcs are all really good at allowing the player to connect on one level or another

it is worth every penny).

I did notice more than several issues with the English translations
column16: some of which are quite big

the translation absolutely needs some work.

[Graphics]

and doesn't really hurt it overall.

[Compatibility]

[Notes regarding Censored Version]
This game has a much merkier past
column25: though a fair number of visual novels do. This game was originally 18+ due to the adult content. This particular version

reviewText:
While I haven't completed all routes on this game yet, with 26 hours of playing (or should I say watching?) and completing 2 routes I think I can write a solid review.

If my heart had wings is a Visual Novel that revolves around gliders and the after school club that wants to build and fly it. I found this a very original subject to base the story lines on. Even though some parts of the story were a bit technical, it didn't bother me. In this VN there are 5 possible girls to date and with the bad ending, this makes 6 possible outcomes. But for some of the options to open, you have to clear the Kotori route.

I started with the Kotori route and that alone took me 20 hours. While I did like her route, I did find it a bit too long, especially because there aren't that many choices to make. The Ageha route I finished in 6 hours, but this is because you can skip all scenes that you have seen before. But you can't skip the new scenes, so this way the game ensures you can't miss anything. Based on these two routes I do think that the game is made for the Kotori route and the other routes are just a nice extra. I think this is true for the Ageha route, at least. While they did try to bring some depth into it, it wasn't nearly as gripping as Kotori's route was. That being said, I have high hopes for the Amane route. I love the music they choose for the intro and ending. The rest is a bit repetitive but it does fit the mood of the moment well.

The one annoying thing about this game were the many spelling errors. For a large part of the game I didn't know if Isuka was a he or a she, because they kept saying it differently and you don't get to meet her in the Kotori route at least. I know there is a pack you can install that fixes this but I didn't do that because I saw it was a bit iffy and a lot of people had problems with the game after that. One other personal dislike for me is that Hotaru wasn't a dating option. Her character was really adorable so that was a bit of a shame.

Overall this is a fun Visual Novel that is worth your time if you like the genre.

reviewText: IMHHW was the first dating-sim game I bought, and I enjoyed it very much. The dialogue is mostly said by Aoi though, and the player cannot direct the flow of the conversation. Overall, I thought IMHHW was a great game, and I would recommend it to anyone who doesn't mind a bit of cheesy romance (in some cases XD).

reviewText: A triumph of literature, art, and music, If My Heart Had Wings takes the reader on a bold adventure of love, hope, and achievement. Telling the story through the eyes of our wounded protagonist, IMHHW delivers a heart-wrenching tale complete with loveable characters, visual beauty, and a soundtrack that ranges from bliss to despondency. The reader embarks on an emotional roller-coaster, travelling across the entire spectrum of thoughts and feelings, leaving them to ask, How is it possible to become so attached to fictitious characters?" Much like a good novel
date: there is a certain melancholy readily apparent for the player when the tale is finished. "Why couldn't our story continue on forever?" Nonetheless
recommended: it is impossible not to smile meekly in hindsight at the trials and experiences of our protagonist
hoursPlayed: and wish him the best on his continued adventures in the cosmos of our imaginations.\n\nIMHHW is
voteText: of course
helpfulPercent: a visual novel
votesHelpful: so the reader is not expected to interract within the game beyond passing through the dialogue provided by the story. There are a few critical questions asked of the player
votesTotal: which influence how the game proceeds; they are rare
votesFunny: but their importance cannot be understated. The characters themselves are deep
commentsCount: well established
column16: and loveable; in fact
column17: it is truly a forlorn sense of disappointment when some decisions in the game must be made between them. Beyond the literary exposition provided by the game's text
column18: the characters are also aided by a gorgeous series of artwork. I was shocked by the detail and beauty presented in the story's art
column19: and it added an additional dimension of presentation to not only the novel itself
column20: but also to the development of the characters. Completing the triumverate of sensation is the music provided with the game; while certain events of the game
column21: and the accompanying artwork
column22: provide enough of an emotional pull
column23: the music really brings the story to another level of excellence. We laugh with the characters; we cry with the characters; and together
column24: we are immersed into this tale of young love and boundless expectation colliding with the sometimes cruel advacement of reality. I cannot speak too much on the quality of the voice acting
column25: because I am not a fluent speaker
column26: but each of the voices of the characters fit into their character archetypes and gave another level of realism to them.\n\nThe story itself is very long
column27: but not too long; never is the reader left idle in a state of boredom. I took more than ten hours to finish the story
column28: and I am an extremely quick reader; do not make my mistake of beginning this game after 4 PM
column29: because if you find the story as engrossing as I did you will not be able to leave until it concludes (a long time into the next day!) I daresay it may be impossible for the average reader to finish this story in one sitting; I would recommend pausing after each chapter is completed (I believe the chapters are called "Movies" in the game itself).\n\nThere are a few grammatical errors in the dialogues
column30: which I attribute to the translation efforts for the game. Most of them aren't significant issues; in fact
column32: over the course of literally thousands of lines of dialogue
column33: there are only several mistakes that I noticed. The only egregious mistakes I noticed were in the gender of the pronouns; twice or three times
column34: I noticed that a character is incorectly assigned a gender pronoun. This was only a major issue in one of the lines of dialogue (because it references an unmet character
column35: so you are confused as to that character's gender). These complaints
column37: should not factor into the consideration to purchase this story.\n\nThere is only one facetious complaint I will make. The authors of this novel have constructed a tale so emotionally engrossing that it will leave you thoroughly invested into the plot's outcome. Dare I say
column38: the worst part of this visual novel is the fact that it had to end; that I had to bid goodbye to the characters I had grown so attached to; I had to face the sudden realization that none of the events of this story had actually happened. That fundamental attribute of this novel makes it comperable to any other literay work
column39: such as a printed novel; and
column40: despite the fact that I am saddened to have to leave this tale behind for now
column41: I will thoroughly recommend it to any reader who wishes to enjoy such a story.\n\nI cannot make this final claim for certain
column42: because I have only read through the novel once
column43: but I am willing to believe that the ending will change fundamentally depending on the choices made in the game. If I had to guess (again
column44: I have not played it through multiple times
column46: there may be as many as five endings to the game
column47: which adds an incentive to return to the mythos of IMHHW. Thankfully
column49: I am provided a reason to play through the story once again
column50: and return to visit my fictional friends once more."

reviewText:
FREAKING GORGEOUS VISUALS!!

This is by far the most beautiful visual novel I've ever encoutered. Unlike others there's frequent scene changes, almost everything is animated or drawn, and there's even mini-animations outside of cutscenes! This is on a whole different level than any other VN I've ever played, and I've played a good deal.

Other bonuses: did I mention the art is FLAWLESS?! I'm in love with the backgrounds. The sountrack is beautiful, and there's tons of voice-overs to go with the text. I think they do a good job of balancing the appeal between all the characters, usually I only feel attached to one or two. I'm really enjoying the story so far. I got so caught up in it that I read all through the night and ended up only getting a couple hours sleep. Oh, and I do reccomend getting the restoration patch. Without it you do lose some of the story.

My only complaint is that there are very few options to choose from on each route. I like shaping the story throughout, so If My Heart Had Wings is limited in that sense. Even so, it's a great buy. =)

Overall : 9.5/10. Worth your money, worth your time.

reviewText:
Finished 'If My Heart Had Wings' - or rather finished the Common Route - 19 hours in. Obtained 'Bad Ending' (no routes) 21 hours in.

I have next to no desire to re-read content just to play specific routes. I appreciate this is common for VNs, However the 'choices' for IMHHW were so anodyne re: who looks best in a bikini, whom do you wish to accompany to the supermarket, and were so few and far between, that I find it hard to retain any sense of credulity that such choices presented a potential route.

Perhaps I'm playing in the mind-set of an early 40s British guy which is the issue, and one who is not completely au-fait with VNs. But I'll be damned if I will spend hours re-reading the same dialogue, especially narrative that wasn't terribly enthralling in the first place. Except for Armane (for obvious reasons), I never really felt a connection with the characters: Aoi felt like a diluted Murakami protagonist (minus the ubiquitous cat) , whilst Kotori had annoying mannerisms, especially her frequent open mouth - jabbing finger expression.

I get that the game pushes you down the main [Kotori] route, but to such an extent that with the exception of Ageha, the relationships with other characters were hardly developed beyond the usual harem tropes.

What it boils down to is that excellent production values and musical score aside (the standard to which all VNs shall be judged production wise), the actual narrative itself was fairly soporific. I did enjoy IMHHW otherwise I wouldn't have persisted. That said, it is pretty much standard high-school angst / shojo, unless you have a fascination with the technical detail for gliders.

reviewText:
If My Heart Had Wings is one of the best visual novels I have ever played. I highly recommend it to those who are a big fan of visual novels. This visual novel is very well-balanced. Each heroine has their own unique story and twist, making every replay totally worth it. You'll also learn some things about friendship, romance and planes (gliders). The story's span can go for a lot of hours. (if you don't intend to skip the dialogues that is) It took me a handful of 50 hours to completely clear all five character routes. One playthrough is composed of two parts: (1) Prologue (2) Character Route. The VN's price is a bit high but it is totally worth it. Try to buy it when it goes on sale once again.

I promise you, If My Heart Had Wings will make you smile and shed a tear. If you're a big visual novel fan or looking for a great visual novel to play on Steam, then this is a MUST BUY for you!

NOTE:
The actual visual novel here on Stean doesn't have H-Scenes but a restoration patch is already available.

reviewText:
I liked this game a lot. Each route is a different in its own way and will give you more dept info about the game world.
This game includes 6 different routes:Kotori, Ageha, Amane, Asa, Asa&Yoru Harem and Bad end.

Story it self is ok and at least for me it gave some goosebumps from time to time.
Romance in this is also fine. There are about 4 points where you can choose what to do from usually 3 to 4 options, in each route.
Some routes are easier than others, for example Asa and Yoru routes are the hardes ones and Kotori and Ageha are the easiest ones to reach.

If you play this first time I would recommend either Kotori OR Amane route first.
Those both routes will give you the most answers and explanations about the story and whats actually happening.
Others routes are also fine and sweet but from experience, I would recommend to start with these.

There are some flaws in this game, big ones being that Ageharoute is really confusing since translating the jokes and some other parts were untranslatable or didn't make any sense what so ever. Its still playable but I found my self really confused and annoyed about whats happening and why, even with the restoration patch the route is slightly annoying but not as bad.
Other flaws are that the creators, at least in my opinion focused too much on explaining how gliders etc work.
They made it so, that its really boring to read and skipping them wont affect on your knowledge on whats happening in the story one bit. On first playthrough it might be fun to read about an hour or two lasting scenes how glider acceleration and wind works, but when playing 2nd time, its just plain boring.

I really recommend downloading the restoration patch even if your not a pervert. Reason for that is, that it will open some normal scenes which were censured since the little french girls would be offended and not like the game.
Here is a good guide on how to get the Patch
NOTE: When downloading the the patch you need to change some language setting in your computer or something. Those WONT affect in any way and you should not worry a thing. If it bother you, you can always switch it back.

Final score: 8/10. (rated from: 4 - 10)
Reason: Story and romance were sweet and all, but the trouble downloading the patch and the annoying moments downgraded the score.

reviewText:
This really seemed like an amazing game. The atmosphere is good, fitting music (although way too repetitive) and nicely designed characters. However, this great experience slowly got ruined for me.

While at first I noticed small translation errors, the moment the general route was over and I moved to a character route (Ageha) the text got really confusing, full of grammar errors and wrong subjects (you instead of I, etc.)

While the art and atmosphere is lovely, the story was a bit too predictable and furthermore too stretched out. I had to really force myself to read through certain parts. That and way too many standard H-game stereotypes...


tldr; Could have been great, but the standard characters, stretched out story and horrible translation (together with quite hard to fix censorship on Windows 8) makes it a below par game sadly...

reviewText:
I Just recently started getting into VNs and this is the first one I have completed and I wanted to start off by saying I loved it.

Pros:
-Great story line
-Interesting characters
-Great soundtrack
-Story progresses smoothly and is nicely paced
-awesome artwork and visuals
-Girls, girls everywhere
-really gets you devoted to the characters and the story
-long :) lots of material to read through
-the different paths are all great (i suggest Amane, because she is <3 )

Cons:
-VNs are not for everyone so I suggest checking out a demo before paying the $15 price
-Some typos

Overall:
This was a great introduction for me into Visual Novels and I can gladly say that I will be playing more in the future. The story line was great, the soundtrack was awesome, and the characters were all interesting. There are funny parts and there are some sad parts. The VN takes a while to get through (over 25 hours for my first playthrough) so you really get attached to the characters. If you are thinking about getting into Visual Novels, this is a great place to start!
You pay more attention to your fake anime girlfriend then you do to me"-My girlfriend
9/10"

All the best in your play through!

reviewText:
A fun and engaging VN with a good soundtrack, but there's a couple of points to watch out for:

1) it's super long. Like, suuuuuuper long.

2) There's many faults in translating. Some of the lines make no sense, and there's several cases of contradicting pronouns (referring to the same character as both a he and a she), sometimes in the same dialogue box. There's also the clear mistranslations I can hear when the text is voiced

If possible I'd like to be able to switch back and forth between eng and jp text for reference, like I was able to with Nekopara.

also the late 90's low res CG is super real in this game. That may be a plus or a minus depending on taste.

reviewText:
+Art
+Story
+Voice Acting
+Music

-At times the story gets a little long winded or drags on about everyday life
-Not a huge soundtrack and gets a little repetitive at times (Zzzzz relaxing)

As my first foray into a VN it's generally a positive experience. Art, music, voice acting, are all solid. The writing, while not entirely original, manages to sprinkle in anime tropes without being glaringly obvious. In other words it's a good read that doesn't tick off tropes from the list" in such an obvious fashion as to make one roll ones eyes. If I had to make a complaint it would be the pacing at the start. While it's refreshing in a way that the game doesn't take the typical route of a slice of life anime where they have overly bombastic friends/situations to keep the tension high
date: I found myself pulled out of my immersion by my anticipation of when I'd actually be able to make a choice (Edit-will just enjoy the ride the next time). The writing is thoughtful and introspective
recommended:
but like a warm summer day with nothing to do. It may occupy you but eventually you'll be shaken from your reverie having to acknowledge your boredom (worth waiting for the climax). Ymmv. For me it was probably amplified by the generally somber music.

*Edit*
Well it took me a while to finish as I got sidetracked a bit but man great ending. It's a bit of a roller coaster and a bit sappy at times but the payoff is great and in hindsight is supported rather well by a story that felt more like minced life instead of slice of life (aka got stuck in minutiae).

Will play again."

reviewText:
10/10
To me, If My Heart Had Wings is the standard that visual novels will probably always struggle to live up to.

Positives:
-The art/backgrounds are gorgeous - I've taken about 50 screenshots to keep for backgrounds
-The music is superb, though doesn't vary all that much.  Considering the length of the novel though, I really can't hold that against it
-Every character that matters is richly developed. It is very easy to become emotionally engaged with all of them. The side characters serve their purposes without being unneccessarily detailed.
-I feel like the sheer length of the novel deserves praise (23 hours or so for me). I would expect a story about gliders and flight mechanics to be mostly niche appeal, but the heart of the story is independent from that.  The story is enticing by virtue of a common goal shared by well developed characters, and the story manages to sustain itself without boring phases.  Flight and flying mechanics are almost an aside and the techicalities are made accessible and actually interesting.

Negatives:
-I'm not sure what happened, but like halfway through the novel it's like the development was either rushed or handed over to someone less competent. There were no typos or bad translations in the first half, then for a while they are almost commonplace.  Not enough to ruin the novel obviously, but disappointing and confusing once it becomes noticeable.  At one point, the main character finds something handmade and wonders who made it.  The character in the wheelchair is blatantly referred to as the cripple" and presumed incapable of folding some oragami thing.  Likely bad translation but pretty inappropriate and surprising it made it through revision.

Overall
date: my all time favorite visual novel.  10/10"

reviewText:
If you're here for the whole game including the ecchi CGs this is not for you as it's a censored (and pretty butchered, if I may say) version of the game. It doesn't affected me as I don't really care about the ecchi parts but the bad translation did bother me quite a bit. If you feel like the translation might get to you or that you absolutely need the ecchi parts then buy the game and get the restoring patch somewhere.

All in all I do recommend everyone to play this game because it has a nice long story and great graphics that will not let you down. The voice acting is also a nice touch.
Also, there are plenty of routes to take and each one has different things happening so it is definitely worth playing all of them to see every possible ending. Tbh from the start I just wanted to take Amane's route but taking others wasn't bad at all.

Personally I feel like Amane's route was the one that made the most sense so far as it actually gave all the answers needed. I'm biased though so you might feel different. Anyway. Buy.The.Game.

reviewText:
Well well...
To be honest this Review could be kept quite short, because no matter how great this VN might be, there is one thing, that prevents this from actually being recommendable. And thats the localisation...

Just to get that straight: I quite like the VN. The characters are good, the story has some interesting aspects and the soundtrack is good. The visuals are ok and the technical side of things is ok as well. There is that annoying feature" that requires you to play some Routes prior to others
date: but that can be bypassed by just setting it do skip and auto and leaving the Room for 30 minutes to not spoiler yourself.\n\nBut the localisation is absolutely HORRIBLE. It seems like some amateurs done it in 5 days without sleep just keeping theirselves alive with energy drinks. Grammatical misstakes can occour and if its not common I can turn an eye off that one
recommended: but I had 2-3 of those per 5 minutes! And while most of those dont cripple the meaning of the sentence
hoursPlayed: there are some misstakes which (its no big spoiler
voteText: but I marked it anyway)  mix up the "Soaring Club" and the "Touring Club" calling the "Touring Club" "Soaring Club" and mixing up personal pronouns what lets you believe that the main cast has joined the "Touring Club" which is not the case!!!.\n\nI haven't played through the whole thing however I can say that you have to be quite good at understanding english and be quite careful while reading this

reviewText: Yes it is censored, like duh, it is steam, even if they want to know if you're over 18 they'll still do this to you. What you think I'm being harsh, cause I am, not that I find that it takes away from the awesome story at all. Seriously even with out the H scenes which I hear you can get back through the Restoration Patch that I found out after completed a whole route. To lazy to use it because I don't want to go through all of that again. So this game has a really, and I mean really good story to it and is worth the time you take to get it over and done with. I think it took me around 10 to 12 hours to do all of it, have no idea why my steam time says I've clock 14 hours. But it is a very good VN, well the story at least and that what makes me recommend it to you. If you want H scenes get the Patch it is linked in discussions on the game. It was good fun and I think the only things that trumps this in VN so far is fruits of grisaia in story and hours you rack up in it.

reviewText:
The story and characters presented in this Visual Novel (VN) were spectacular and I greatly enjoyed my time with If My Heart Had Wings. However, for those in the know, there are a some of issues surrounding this game. For those not in the know, I'll go over what I feel are the major ones:
1. The English translation is clunky and awkward at times. There are issues with grammar and proper translations, but the message and intent of the writing come through at least for me. There are some concepts that weren't transdlated well into English for one reason or another. As such it helps to have a little understanding of some topics and concepts of Japanese culture.
2.a. This is an edited version which excludes adult content from the original Japanese release. This is a controversial topic in general. It speaks to topics such as censorship and cultural acceptance of adult themes/elements within entertainment mediums. What does this mean for the gameplay experience? It means three out of five of the game routes seem unfinished/empty. The devs tried thier best to weave together the fragments of story after taking out the adult scenes were cut out and for the most part they do it well enough. However during certain scenes they didn't try much at all. I'll just say in certain scenes where the art covers the naughty bits, the dialogue still acknowledges the nudity which for me created a jarring effect in those scenes.
2.b. If you had heard about this game and were expecting adult content, it's not there in this Western" release as the dev citing a desire to market to a broader audience.

That being said
date: the presentation of the VN itself is very polished in the features and UI. The amount of work put into the original release and this translation (albeit an imperfect translation/localization) can be clearly seen. There is a strong story being wich is backed up by fantastic voice acting for all the characters (except the main protagonist). Yes
recommended: voice acting for ALL the characters and good voice acting to boot. Keep an open mind going in and you'll get a fantastic experience with  this VN."
hoursPlayed: April 19, 2015
voteText: true

reviewText:
Probably my favorite game (or VN) on Steam and my GOTY 2014. This sounds extreme, but I mean it. The characters are very well done and actually lovable, the art quality is phenomenal and the voice acting is super well done (according to my Japanese friend)
There are negatives, so I'll state them right here: The translation job is bad at times. Typos are rare but happen enough to be consistent, and there was a character never shown on screen, whose gender was unkown, and the description kept popping from he to she to him to her, it was confusing.
Oh and obviously the game is censored to the extreme, because of Steam, but that's not really a negative, as this game is less hentai or even ecchi, and is more about the wonderful story and characters.
Pros? As said the characters are really easy to get attached to, the art is good, but what else? Well I can remember the soundtrack after I stop playing, so that's something.
But really, it's very long. Like, I mean, it takes 5 hours to get the THE INTRO MOVIE. Not only is it very very long, but it has multiple paths, so replay value is high especially with such well done girls (though some are more best than others, such as Kotori)
And the game is really inspiring and uplifting to boot.

I genuinely adore this VN, and would highly recommend it. One of the biggest pros of all, is it's on Steam, AND this good. It's a step in the right direction for Steam, after the several bad VNs that have been put on here. This along with Fault Milestone have changed my mind, and I welcome the genre.
voteText: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful

reviewText: If My Heart Had Wings is the greatest visual novel I have ever experienced.  The story is full of heart-touching emotion that leaves an effect on you.  My biggest complaint is that there is so much story, you cannot possibly just sit down and enjoy it all at once (unless you have no life, then by all means enjoy it from beginning to end!)  I have only completed one of the story arcs, and with I think five more to try, this story can keep me entertained for some time to come!   Even the music should have a special mention... it has a smooth melody that can easily slip into the background, but is can also be so noticeable, you can feel the scene's tone in the music.  I'd recommend this to anyone, but especially those who have a passion for flying.\n\nPositive thoughts aside, the English has some noticeable errors between translation and grammar, but they are usually too few to care about.

reviewText:
I wish I could hit the Recommend button more than once.

Within the past several months, I've been getting progressively more interested in Visual Novels, and when I saw that this one came highly recommended on Steam and that it was even on sale as well, I decided to pick it up.

I was not disappointed.

This is by far the longest Visual Novel I have ever played myself, with the first route taking just over 25 hours (no skipping, no auto, watching through the 3 cutscenes in their entirety), so considering I only paid 9 dollars for what turned out to be over 50 hours of playtime to complete all routes...I definitely got my money's worth.

I would recommend this VN to everyone, those new to them like myself and also those with more experience with them. Every single route tugged an entirely different heartstring, and none disappointed. If I had to rank the routes in order of how much I like them (which for me, is a Herculean task), it would be as follows:

3-way tie for 1st: Kotori, Amane, and Asa
Strong and close 2nd: Ageha
Last but certainly not least: Yoru

The artwork is fantastically done and the music....is by far the strong point of the novel. Each emotional/touching moment is paired with a song, and these songs do an AMAZING job of evoking the right feelings for their respective scenes. You can check them out on Youtube...my favorite tracks are A New World

reviewText: The story of My Heart Had Wings is fairly engaging, even if it has the classic VN problems of being way too long and in dire need of editing down, and being full of annoying anime cliche nonsense. It also suffers from being really weak at first, with characters only becoming bearable hours into the story. However, the editing in this game is actually inexcusable. The translation is already kind of spotty, with some scenes making very little sense and the prose generally being fairly curt, but as some point they just fired all the beta testers. http://imgur.com/a/Mj5HI All of these mistakes are within a couple scenes of each other, and at the same time a bunch of scenes become borderline incomprehensible in their translation and some lines are quite clearly mistranslated, even to someone who doesn't speak the language, just by context. Additionally, some lines start getting attributed as narration, there's horrible inconsistency in honorfics, a character who has been nothing but sensitive suddenly calls a character a cripple" in a really dismissive way... it's actually unbelievable. There's enough good stories in the world that you don't need to spend a huge amount of time on an alright story told way too slowly with appalling unprofessional localisation."

I genuinely adore this VN, and would highly recommend it. One of the biggest pros of all, is it's on Steam, AND this good. It's a step in the right direction for Steam, after the several bad VNs that have been put on here. This along with Fault Milestone have changed my mind, and I welcome the genre.

reviewText: If My Heart Had Wings is the greatest visual novel I have ever experienced.  The story is full of heart-touching emotion that leaves an effect on you.  My biggest complaint is that there is so much story, you cannot possibly just sit down and enjoy it all at once (unless you have no life, then by all means enjoy it from beginning to end!)  I have only completed one of the story arcs, and with I think five more to try, this story can keep me entertained for some time to come!   Even the music should have a special mention... it has a smooth melody that can easily slip into the background, but is can also be so noticeable, you can feel the scene's tone in the music.  I'd recommend this to anyone, but especially those who have a passion for flying.\n\nPositive thoughts aside, the English has some noticeable errors between translation and grammar, but they are usually too few to care about.

reviewText:
I wish I could hit the Recommend button more than once.

Within the past several months, I've been getting progressively more interested in Visual Novels, and when I saw that this one came highly recommended on Steam and that it was even on sale as well, I decided to pick it up.

I was not disappointed.

This is by far the longest Visual Novel I have ever played myself, with the first route taking just over 25 hours (no skipping, no auto, watching through the 3 cutscenes in their entirety), so considering I only paid 9 dollars for what turned out to be over 50 hours of playtime to complete all routes...I definitely got my money's worth.

I would recommend this VN to everyone, those new to them like myself and also those with more experience with them. Every single route tugged an entirely different heartstring, and none disappointed. If I had to rank the routes in order of how much I like them (which for me, is a Herculean task), it would be as follows:

3-way tie for 1st: Kotori, Amane, and Asa
Strong and close 2nd: Ageha
Last but certainly not least: Yoru

The artwork is fantastically done and the music....is by far the strong point of the novel. Each emotional/touching moment is paired with a song, and these songs do an AMAZING job of evoking the right feelings for their respective scenes. You can check them out on Youtube...my favorite tracks are A New World

reviewText: The story of My Heart Had Wings is fairly engaging, even if it has the classic VN problems of being way too long and in dire need of editing down, and being full of annoying anime cliche nonsense. It also suffers from being really weak at first, with characters only becoming bearable hours into the story. However, the editing in this game is actually inexcusable. The translation is already kind of spotty, with some scenes making very little sense and the prose generally being fairly curt, but as some point they just fired all the beta testers. http://imgur.com/a/Mj5HI All of these mistakes are within a couple scenes of each other, and at the same time a bunch of scenes become borderline incomprehensible in their translation and some lines are quite clearly mistranslated, even to someone who doesn't speak the language, just by context. Additionally, some lines start getting attributed as narration, there's horrible inconsistency in honorfics, a character who has been nothing but sensitive suddenly calls a character a cripple" in a really dismissive way... it's actually unbelievable. There's enough good stories in the world that you don't need to spend a huge amount of time on an alright story told way too slowly with appalling unprofessional localisation."

reviewText:
Not even 40% into this Visual Novel and it's already shaped up to be one of my all time favorites alongside Clannad, Kanon, and a bunch of other Key Art VNs, It took me approx 20 hours to finish the Ageha storyline(And I'm a decently quick reader!), and I have 5 other lines to go, so time wise I can 100% suggest this wonderful specimen of a story to anyone.

The characters are absolutely amazing, they're rather realistic almost scarily so, all the characters in some form are relatable, and all of them have a deep backstory which makes the player(atleast in my experience) more involved  and interested in the story and who the character actually is, and to some form you actually come to care for the characters, be it laughing with them, at them, crying when something sad happens, being happy for them, sad, etcetc, all of the main major feelings tend to be dragged from the player as you proceed to play.

The music is aboslutley amazing, the art is amazing(though I fish they'd change the clothing of their characters here and there, it's a little tiring to see them in like 2-3 different sets of clothing so far, but I guess that is a small issue for such an amazing game. The only other issue is the localization, it seems off every so often, incorrect spelling, repeating words, etcetc, but if you can ignore that, it's extremely well done!

All in all, 9/10 so far for this, if the spelling and art was done slightly better it'd be a 100% 10/10.

I will also edit this as I play more, to include all the other story lines.

reviewText: Bear in mind that I'm unfamiliar with most anime/manga/otaku terminologies. I also have read very few VNs and watched even fewer animes. So here's my review, beginning with the negative points: Aweful translation. I could've done a better job if I knew Japanese. The problem is in the Moenovel's understanding of English and western culture, I can guarantee it. People are talking about how Ageha's route is drastically changed. I wouldn't have minded that if not for the sloppy translation job. I am afraid that it is going to be like the translation, half-baked and full of inconsistencies. The introduction of clearly waaay underage Asa and Yoru as romancable characters freaked me out. I understand that there is an audience for it but cultural differences made it harder for me to continue. That's all the complaints I have with the novel. Everything else, like the plot, music, artwork and assets, is above average. The rough translation job might have butchered some of the cultural references and jokes but I wouldn't have got them anyway. I was specially impressed with the music and art style. The teams behind them are infinitely talented. I can't say much about voice acting as I'm totally Japanese-illiterate, but they did sound authentic and far from melodramatic or dull as with some VNs I've read before. Don't be fooled by typical anime cliches, the rest of it makes the VN so great that you won't even notice them. Go for it and take the soundtrack too, it's lovely.\n\nUpdate: I have installed the Restoration patch to see what's all the fuss behind it. And oh boy!!! Moenovel has totally butchered the game. It's not that it os bad, it is actually very good as far as the Kotori route goes but that is because the original Japanese material was exceptional, as proven by the restoration patch. Moenovel hasn't just cut the h-scenes which are frankly an important part of the Ageha arc according to many(which is why Moenovel rewrote it), but they also removed any kind of adult jokes and many important plot elements and CGs. The Restored" version of the game feels like the GOTY edition of the Batman games. The translation job is still as sloppy as ever but a bit better than vanilla Moenovel release. If My Heart Had Wings was originally meany to be a young adult game which is suger-coated due to cultural barriers and taboo and stereotypes circulating japanese media. They should have made an official 18+ patch."

date: If My Heart Had Wings could've been a nice and sometimes touching VN-love story, but, well.. the pacing of this game. It's just horrible in my opinion. I didn't even expect much drama, but basically almost NOTHING exciting happened at all.\nOn the positive side, the artwork is well done (most of the times) and the OP / ED songs are pretty catchy. But that's by far not enough for a good VN if you ask me. Not recommended.

reviewText: While the story is very heartfelt, the actual translation is very spotty.  It feels like a first draft that was shipped as a complete project.  There are very many cases of the wrong pronoun being used or the wrong name being referenced as well as numerous cases where words are missing from sentences.  Also there is even one route where what is normally referred to as the soaring club" is just "Soaring".  The whole script could use another editing pass but if you can work your way through these issues
date: I would recommend getting this only if it's on sale.  The current state of the translation is not worth the full asking price."

reviewText:
I thought I'd just play this game casually but why not let it consume my soul instead?

I got this game only recently with the Holiday sale and it took a big chunk out of my life after that. I got so wrapped up into the story I'd forget the time. I honestly didn't care much for dating simulators but this one is crafted well with it's beautiful art, character designs and story. It lives up to the Visual Novel" selling point however this game is not perfect but is still rather engaging.

Story (Intro):
You play as Aoi
date: who I learned to like as a character. Who's moved back to his hometown after a cycling accident. The intro to this game is pretty hefty
recommended: only after 7 hours did I make my first choice and there was good chunks of time between each choice. The main plot point is that you become a member / pilot of the "Soaring Club" and with Kotori
hoursPlayed: Ahega
voteText: Amane
helpfulPercent: Asa
votesHelpful:
Koru and other side characters that you strive for your goal in flying above the rare clouds of "Morning Glory". In doing so you must travel down one of six paths held before you and achieve this goal.

The order in which you take these paths can be of your choosing to some extent.
Kotori can be done on the first or second succesful try.
Amane and Asa can be done anytime after Kotori.
Ahega can be done at anytime.
And Yoru can only be done after Kotori and Asa.
Depending on which girl you pick
votesTotal:
the story can differ extremely. The first 6 hours before movie I (Act 1) unfold the same no matter what. Act 2 (Between movie I and II) is where 4 of your choices are made and Act 3 (Between movie II and III) is where (at most) two choices are made. After that you're just along for the ride.

Story (Kotori):
This was the first route I completed and one I enjoyed the second most. It was also the longest to complete due to it being the first one I completed and took up 40% of the game (Including the common routes).
The things I enjoyed most of this storyline was The love confession in the new glider's test flight
votesFunny: The way Aoi chased after Kotori on his bike even after his injury
commentsCount: When everyone got together and pulled the glider to get it airborne and using glowsticks
column16: gide them to the winds. and finally The ending
column17:
where Kotori got surgery and began to walk again  which made me shed a single tear.

Story (Amane):
This was my second completed route and easily my favourite. This was the easiest due to it having the least choices compared to the other routes. There was so much I loved about this route
column18: like It's the only route that let's you keep the school garage until Act 4
column19: The whole head in lap thing with Amane is ♥♥♥♥ing adorable
column20: It's the only route which made me feel somewhat sorry for Mr. Tabioka with the letter and made me understand his actions
column21: You learn everything about Isaka due to being so close with Amane and see Amane and Isaka in they're actual school years. Not to mention Isaka returns and is reunited with Amane and considering she's the girl on the title art and that she's half the reason the Soaring Club is still going is pretty damn awesome. And finally
column22: An-Chan (My favourite side character) is in love with Isaka and because you chose Amane
column23:
you help him find his love for her again and you go on double dates and other cute ♥♥♥♥.

Story (Ahega):
Third completed
column24: third favourite and easily the most frustrating and cheesy route. There's nothing overly wrong with this route it's just that Aoi jumps though so many ♥♥♥♥ing hoops for this girl compared to how easy it was to get Kotori or Amane. However the payoff made it pretty worth it with the moments before takeoff
column25: Ahega just straight up grabs you and kisses you infront of everyone to prove a point
column26:
you also get a damn sports car to pull your gilder airborne on a bridge and you have the best conversation with Ahega through the Radio after take off. Ahega is easily the worlds biggest tease and I enjoyed all of it.

Story (Asa):
Fourth down and fourth favourite
column27: there wasn't too much (at this point in the game) that really grabbed me about this route. Asa didn't get much screen time without her sister and after  breaking Yoru's heart to go for asa
column28:
I felt really bad and I couldn't find myself invested into the route. It's also the only route in which the real Morning Glory comes in that second summer however it shows up two years later but you don't see Asa and Yoru fly into it.

Story (Yoru):
Last up and least favourite for multiple reasons. The big one is that you never actually pick Yoru
column29:
you just say neither of them then she decides that you should date both of them which annoyed me because I (personally) liked Yoru more than I liked Asa (as a character). The only thing I did enjoy was when Asa was out of the picture and it was just you and Yoru.

Art:
From the previews above you can see the main art style of the story. Most of it is characters standing infront of a background with different poses and facial expressions but there are some beautifully drawn scenes
column30:
all of which are wallpaper worthy. There is also a chibi art style that's used to convey messages which I loved. It's also used for the acheivement "Too bad!".

Final Thoughts:
I played the vanilla version and didn't realise this was heavily censored
column31: I might go back and install it to see the differences. I did still enjoy it however. The bad translating at points broke the immersion like the mixing up of pronouns (Tobioka was known as a she for a whole scene) and the mix up of names got me confused at times but all in all it was a fun 51 hours of my life.\n\n8.5/10 would 100% again."

Okay jokes aside, this game is really good and defines what a visual novel should be except for one category: some good grammar. This game has one of the loveliest art and animation I've ever seen. The story and characters are amazing too.
The music is good enough. but not the best.

The biggest problem is the translation. Literally almost all sentence has an error. like 7/10 dialogue slides across the game has wrong spellings, punctuations, tenses, etc. Heck even some sentences are completely broken. But they do enough to make it at least understandable.

Story: 8/10
Characters: 9/10
Art: 10/10
Animation: 10/10
Translation: 0/10
Voice Acting: 10/10
Overall: 8/10

Get this game if you want some relaxing and entertaining story.
Don't  get the game if you're a grammar nazi, since your eyes will be bleeding by the time you open the game.
Get this game if you want some hentai by pathing the game up. ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

reviewText:
Sorry people, this game doesn't earn my recommendation.  If you like graphic novels, go ahead and play through this one, but I didn't find it very enjoyable.  I did like the characters, but I found the story to be bland and slow-moving.  The music was mediocre.  The translation had frequent rough spots.

I probably would have enjoyed the story more as an anime or even as the visual novel if it had english voiceacting, but as it is, I played 9 hours that I enjoyed mildly and then lost interest.

Conclusion: Unless you have played and enjoyed previous Japanese visual novels, spend your time elsewhere.

reviewText:
I give this game a 3/10

Pros:
- Fantastic art
- The movies are very nice
- The music is nice
- The voice actors are talented

Cons:
- The women are unrelatable and none of them are particularly appealing
- The writing is pretty bad because there are lots of unnecessary and boring details. It all feels very tedious and when you accidentally miss a bit of dialogue, you end up just not caring because you are trying to make it all over as soon as possible
- I am 4 hours into the game and I still feel like I know barely anything about the characters and it is all very predictable where everything is going
- The basic format of this game is to tell and not show. With visual novels, I like to have the writer just assume that yes, I can see what is on the screen so no, I don't need every little thing described to me.
- When we are introduced to one of the main characters at first, she is sweet, lovely and very likable. She quickly turns in to a complete pain in the ♥♥♥♥ with a bad attitude. I know we are supposed to feel sympathy for her because yes, she is disabled but I know a lot of disabled people who don't use it as an excuse to be a total ♥♥♥♥ to everyone.

As I said, 3/10 - I have tried with this game. I really have. It is just unplayable it is so boring.

reviewText:
I'm sorry, but when the game offers the option to pause at options, that's meant to imply that there IS one. I hit skip to speed things up a little and it just ploughs through scene after scene after scene, stopping at nothing. Make no mistake, I checked the settings numerous times. It's just like watching an anime, this is not a game. You've been warned. It's barely animated at that. Spend $15 on a pirated anime, you will enjoy it more. Can't say I like it and will be doing my best to get money back.

Edit:
Visuals are great, receives many compliments from others whom are likely more knowledgeable than myself in this genre. Good at what it's meant to be.

Note to others like myself. This is not terribly interactive, but good for those who love reading and story lines.

reviewText:
Well.. I've officially played the game for about 5 hours(I read the dialogue fully though) and just got my first actual choice. However, although I am miffed at how long it took, I actually feel like I understand who the characters are now and have even become emotionally attached to some of them. Therefore, my decisions will mean more moving forward.

Bottom line: Although I enjoy VN's, I will admit, I mainly bought this game for the glider and the fact that as a career pilot, I am attracted to all things aviation related. This far in, I can honestly say that, excluding the glider, it's a great story.... Including the glider, it's an awesome story and if the skies at all intrigue you, you will be hooked! Also, unlike most aviation related media, this game actually is truthful and realistic towards aviation, rather than the fear-mongering that most media has taken to!

So far(I technically have only seen the intro) 10/10. Would buy it again!

reviewText:
If My Heart Had Wings (Kono Oozora ni, Tsubasa wo Hirogete)
VNDB: https://vndb.org/v9093

Description:
Aoi returned to his hometown of Kazegaura where a gentle breeze blows through the streets, having lost his direction in life. On the hill lined with windmills, he met a wheelchair-ridden girl Kotori and watched the gliders overhead in awe. With his childhood friend Ageha in tow, they resurrect the soaring club in order to fulfill a childhood dream: to fly on a glider.

Pros:
Nice BGM, nice CG, a touching story (?) with a sense of comedy in it. This long VN (30 - 50 hours) worth the money I spend. And Himegi Ageha <3

Cons:
Bad translation, typos, typos and typos. It fixed (maybe?) when we use the restoration patch which also would restore the removed scene (but also remove the Steam features, too bad)

reviewText:
Best Visual Novel I have played as of yet period. Just one play through can consist of over 15 hours of gameplay to complete assuming there are no skips involved. Each of the characters personalities was planned well, they compliment the story design fairly well. The soundtrack is beautiful hopefully, they will release the full soundtrack as DLC.
The only small fault I have noticed is the mistranslations.

The conversation decisions you make impact who you spend time together with, and how the game ends.

You are Aoi Minaze a young man who is returning to his hometown and is thrust into the position of dorm mother of an all female boarding student manor while preparing to attend a new school. A chance encounter forever changes him and his friends forever. That's about all I can say without spoiling anything for those who intend to play.

All of this synergizes into a very emotional, fufilling experience that any novel, anime or manga reader can easily enjoy.

No ignorance were given to this game because, well, I couldn't even feint an ignorance to it. All I could ever say is to thank the creators for deploying such a wonderful game in the Steam store!

I'm a huge fan of romance and this game absolutely, didn't let me down.

reviewText:
This game has a duck with a tophat, 12/10...

But to be serious, this game is enjoyable for those who like visual novels, and you will spend lots of time trying to get all the ending. To those who don't like visual novels though it goes without saying that this might not be the thing that  changes your mind. It is enjoyable and a fun ride.

If My Heart Had Wings does a lot of things right. The charatures are enjoyable, the plot is something you can follow easliy and enjoyable for the most part, and the music does a great job setting the tone.

There are a few minor problems, the 3D parts don't look amazing and some other errors, but other then that this is a good game.

All in all this game is tons of fun and I highly recommend it to anyone who likes visual novels or to someone who is thinking about playing visual novels themself.

I give the game a 9.25/10

reviewText: If My Heart Had Wings is wonderful VN on ones dream's to fly in the clouds and beyond with your companions and brings beautifully rendered CGI and soothing music that makes it rise above the rest."\n\nFor newcomers to the genre: This isn't just a dating sim
date: its a novel with a story
hoursPlayed: and everything. There's a misconception about Japan eroge that it all must "hentai an pervertedness beyond recognition
voteText:
but this isn't what it fantasizes.

The Experience: 4/5
Finally finished the epilogue and the first route of many (Took 20ish hours). I played some parts with and without the restoration patch and I have to say they're both are pretty well made with some little english translation errors. In all honesty, without the patch you still get the beautiful narrative and story of the characters. The patch only enhances the experience with deeper character developments. Having played the highly prominent VN Majikoi (80+ Hours), I found this one very enjoyable so far going through one route. Its basically a Slice of Life anime and has a very tranquil atmosphere that I can't express in any regard.

Story: 4/5
The epilogue was really well done and was longer than I thought it woud be which is good thing. It set up the atmosphere and characters very well for when you choose your path. There wasn't a point in the tory that I felt wasn't needed, but there were some parts where I skimmed over. I did the Kotori Route first and man did it bring the emotions. I hope to see that more as I go onto the next route. Overall so far, its very bright and a feel inducing rollercoaster that you won't forget.

Graphics/Art: 5/5
Each time you see the sky CGI you could almost feel the breeze. Believe me, you will get absorbed in this game whether you like it or not. The CGI animation with the windmills look fantastic and the glider itself looks awesome along with combination with the wonderfully painted backgrounds, its eye candy.

reviewText: Wow, this game was simply breathtaking.  The visuals were picturesque and the BGM beautifully complemented many of the scenes. I, overall, was given my money's worth and then some.  I laughed, I weeped, and it was a rollercoster that had me clamoring for more.

reviewText:
Well.. I've officially played the game for about 5 hours(I read the dialogue fully though) and just got my first actual choice. However, although I am miffed at how long it took, I actually feel like I understand who the characters are now and have even become emotionally attached to some of them. Therefore, my decisions will mean more moving forward.

Bottom line: Although I enjoy VN's, I will admit, I mainly bought this game for the glider and the fact that as a career pilot, I am attracted to all things aviation related. This far in, I can honestly say that, excluding the glider, it's a great story.... Including the glider, it's an awesome story and if the skies at all intrigue you, you will be hooked! Also, unlike most aviation related media, this game actually is truthful and realistic towards aviation, rather than the fear-mongering that most media has taken to!

So far(I technically have only seen the intro) 10/10. Would buy it again!

reviewText: --Spoiler free\nI'm just starting to play a few visual novels so bear with me as I don't have much to compare this to. However, I must say that I would definitely recommend this visual novel to someone who might be a bit new to the visual novel type of game. If My Heart Had Wings is a story for the most part focused on working arm in arm to achieve goals and dreams, while sharing unforgettable bonds with friends along the way. It has both success and failure, but most importantly you will most likely develop strong attachments to certain characters as I think they're all very loveable.

reviewText:
NOTE: This review was written after playing all possilble routes/using the restoration patch. The score is also somewhat based off my opinion, but even though I have cons agaisnt it I STRONGLY reccomend picking this VN up.

IMHHW is a visual novel that follows the life of a boy name Aoi after returning to his old home town. He mets some old friends and makes some new ones after being given the position of a dorm mother at an all girls off campus house. Throughout the game you make several choices which impact which path you take, as well as alter the ending.

This was my first visual novel after reading Katawa Shoujo. In all honesty I have mixed feelings about it. The introduction and mid-story was very pleasing and kept my interested, but the late-story and ending kind of left me hanging (more so than Katawa Shoujo). I personally don't like open endings because I want to see how things truely ended, but it might appeal to some people.

The soundtrack is amazing, the voice overs add a nice touch, animated cutscenes and images added in to really expand on certain scenes 100% made the game that much more enjoyable.

All in all I'd give it a 8/10, and again the only reason I'm not giving it a higher score is because of my personal opinion on the ending.

reviewText:
9.5/10
If MY Heart Had Wings is a touching, beautiful, romantic VN that can be called nothing short of a masterpiece.
The story is captivating and inspiring and the characters are very easy to get attatched to.
The soundtrack is great.
The only reason it's not a 10/10 is necause of the localisation. I personally don't feel the need for a hentai-packed eroge full of ♥♥♥ shots and sex scenes, but some of the romance is dulled by the fact that even when they allude to mature material, none of it is ever directly addressed. There's no adult content and it's a bit sad because once you've become attatched to the characters, your choices, and the natural flow of the storyline, a little bit of mature material adds to the delightful romance you've set in motion.

I personally don't understand how to replace my game with the Restoration Patch, which is disappointing for me because I'd like to find out what exactly I've missed out on. Only because a few storylines just felt incomplete without a real mature experience to enforce the idea that your romance story has actually progressed in more ways than just telling the girl you like her.

reviewText:
It isn't the best VN that I have read, but If My Heart Had Wings is still really enjoyable.
The plot is branching and it has semi long common route.
It is pretty safe to say that you will be dragged into their world. Not to forget that you will become thirsty for more information about aircraft.

The mood is kinda light, but there will be some events which will make you mournful.
The graphics are beatiful and well done. None of heroines are too cheesy and the protagonist is just a normal guy.
While requiring multiple game through it doesn't surprisingly become unnatural for player.
On the contrary it brings much more depth to the story. I'm not saying that there will be no frustrating moments, but that is just something that needs to be endured.

Background music is relaxing and generates nice mood to events. There is also sound effects that bring more life to events.

Restoration patch isn't must-to-do because you can still enjoy the story, but I'm not doing this to tell you what to do.

reviewText:
I've only played the common route and one character route so far, but here are my impressions:

Positives:
- Setting/Plot: The setting is very believable, but still novel and powerful. This is without a doubt the game's strongest point. The various climaxes of the game, when the action really came together for the Soaring Club to do something amazing, never failed to give me chills and inspire a big emotional response.
- Visuals: the sprites especially are very high-resolution, well-drawn, and unique. I'm admittedly not that knowledgeable about visual novels, but I haven't previously seen one that does varied zoom levels for the character sprites. This game gets a lot of mileage out of that technique, and the sprites always look good while they play these tricks with them. Backgrounds and movies are also great, but the care taken with fine details of the character sprites really steals the show.
- Character design: I find the characters to be varied and interesting, especially the first 3 heroines (I maybe didn't get enough time with the two who appear later to feel much connection with them; maybe this will change when I play their routes, though). The heroines have very distinct, personalities, and are also very independent; they don't depend on their relationship with the main character to define themselves (a common  problem in visual novels, IMO). Admittedly, the heroines all fall into pretty common visual novel tropes, but I don't really view this as a negative so much as an inevitability.

Negatives:
- Translation: The translation for the common route is actually great. I noticed very few odd turns of phrasing, and very few grammatical and spelling mistakes, and only one translation that was simply bizarrely wrong (the repeated appearance of a phrase like Then
date: on the first day of summer"
recommended: when it was clearly inappropriate and clearly didn't match the vocals).\nThat said
hoursPlayed:
the translation for the one character route I have so far played (Kotori's route) was frankly appalling: about half of it suffered from one of:
- very poor English (dialogue that would certainly not have been spoken by a native speaker)
- out of character (wording did not fit for the character)
- nonsensical in context (perhaps a single sentence was translated independent of everything around it
voteText: or without the context of the visuals and voice acting? At any rate
helpfulPercent: it was sometimes clearly wrong
votesHelpful: even with my poor grasp of spoken Japanese)\n- incorrect translation
votesTotal: or failing to correctly capture the mood/emotion of the context (again
votesFunny: even with my poor grasp of spoken Japanese this was very obvious at times)\n\nI would recommend the game as an excellent visual novel
commentsCount: with the caveat that you have to be willing to bear with a terrible translation awaiting you at the end of the game
column16: where the most emotional scenes await. I found that frankly very disappointing
column17: after the earlier parts of the game were so much better-done. I'm holding out hope that it was just the particular route I chose that was terribly translated
column18: and that others will be better when I go back to play through them... One odd thing I noticed was that it was perhaps the first 2/3 of the character route that were especially poorly-translated; the last 1/3 of it was back on track and reasonable. I can't really say whether the problem is going to be so prevalent in other character routes."

reviewText:
I really enjoyed this game, it's got a masterfully written story that (to be honest) brought me to tears more than a few times. While it can be a bit dull at times, the story is relatively interesting, and the soundtrack is absolutely fantastic in and of itself. The UI is a bit hard to get used to at first, but it works well with the game, and I'm just glad that there's a quick-save feature (hasn't been in the last few VNs I played). If you're in it for the hentai (Which I wasn't), then get the restoration patch, otherwise, enjoy this game.

I give it a solid 10/10.

Warning: it can be a bit of a time leech.

reviewText: --Spoiler free\nI'm just starting to play a few visual novels so bear with me as I don't have much to compare this to. However, I must say that I would definitely recommend this visual novel to someone who might be a bit new to the visual novel type of game. If My Heart Had Wings is a story for the most part focused on working arm in arm to achieve goals and dreams, while sharing unforgettable bonds with friends along the way. It has both success and failure, but most importantly you will most likely develop strong attachments to certain characters as I think they're all very loveable.

reviewText:
Although this review will be seen by few, I feel that I need to write it anyway.

If My Had Had Wings is a visual novel, a genre which I've never been a huge fan of. Not because they're not fun, but because it takes a very skilled writer to make one that's worth getting invested in. Yypically those writers stick to writing books because it's far simpler to find a book publisher than it is a team of artists and programmers all working to help make your dream come to life.
This one stands out from the others, however.
The amount of effort put into it to make it immersive, interesting, visually appealing and about anything else you could want is unreal. I'll take it one step at a time.

Visuals - They're more important in this genre than in any other, in my opinion. Stories can be compelling and addicting on their own, but if you're going to throw in artwork, you have to do it well. Otherwise, you end up getting distracted from the story by the game's shortcomings.
The visuals are amazingly done. Hell, the pictures above do better justice than my words. And those aren't edited just to look better or pickings from some concept art, the entire game looks like that, The art style is very consistant and honestly it makes the world the game presents feel even more real.

Audio - I actually didn't expect this game to have full voice acting. That's a huge task, but it's done, at least in Japanese. It seriously helps add to the emotions of everything and while in some visual novels I find myself quickly skipping through text just to get through; in this game I find myself replaying some lines of dialog just to hear them again. I don't speak the language, but the acting is very good. Good enough to make me wait until they've finished speaking to click.
The music is just as impressive, and I've actually been listening to the soundtrack outside of the game. Although I have no connection to this music, some of the songs seriously bring up feelings of nostalgia for me. Perhaps it's just the way they sound, or maybe I'm connecting them to something without knowing. All I know is that the music adds so much to the emotion of scenes that I can't help but get teary-eyed at times.

Story - You be noticing me using the word emotion" a lot in this and there's a reason. Emotion is something this game has that very few games ever have for me. You get so invested into the characters
hoursPlayed: sometimes even knowing exactly how they'll react to something. I find myself verbally responding to many things they say even though there's nobody listening and reacting emotionally just as often.\nIt's lengthy for sure

100/100

Best visual novel in my perspective. I bought it knowing that it has romance in it since I sincerely love romance a lot. Once I've settled on the game, it was amazingly good because I didn't expect it to have so many kissing scenes- Which are my favourite, of course. Not only it has kiss scenes but what do you know; it's harem as well!

Well created game and plots. One of the best things I love in this game, is the art. The art met over my expectations! Plot, it was well planned out. Harem routes were plotted out greatly. Romance sequels were best. You wouldn't expect what comes out next in the scene.

No ignorance were given to this game because, well, I couldn't even feint an ignorance to it. All I could ever say is to thank the creators for deploying such a wonderful game in the Steam store!

I'm a huge fan of romance and this game absolutely, didn't let me down.

The Experience: 4/5
Finally finished the epilogue and the first route of many (Took 20ish hours). I played some parts with and without the restoration patch and I have to say they're both are pretty well made with some little english translation errors. In all honesty, without the patch you still get the beautiful narrative and story of the characters. The patch only enhances the experience with deeper character developments. Having played the highly prominent VN Majikoi (80+ Hours), I found this one very enjoyable so far going through one route. Its basically a Slice of Life anime and has a very tranquil atmosphere that I can't express in any regard.

Story: 4/5
The epilogue was really well done and was longer than I thought it woud be which is good thing. It set up the atmosphere and characters very well for when you choose your path. There wasn't a point in the tory that I felt wasn't needed, but there were some parts where I skimmed over. I did the Kotori Route first and man did it bring the emotions. I hope to see that more as I go onto the next route. Overall so far, its very bright and a feel inducing rollercoaster that you won't forget.

Graphics/Art: 5/5
Each time you see the sky CGI you could almost feel the breeze. Believe me, you will get absorbed in this game whether you like it or not. The CGI animation with the windmills look fantastic and the glider itself looks awesome along with combination with the wonderfully painted backgrounds, its eye candy.
http://imgur.com/c8FcHWV

Audio/Soundtrack: 5/5
The sound track fits perfectly with the atmosphere of the novel and potrays it very well. Its probably one of the best I've heard, then again I've only played 3 VN including this one. Its very soothing and has a vibrant touch to it that makes it upbeat at times. Opening is the best!

reviewText:
If My Heart Had Wings is one of my favorite visual novels, definitely in the top five. I got this game a while back before it went on sale but when I saw it on sale I thought I should write a review about it. This game gave me a massive appreciation of the skies beauty and impossible desire to fly a plane. The story was longe and really interesting, I only felt a dull moment once or twice before things became interesting or fun. All of the characters are voiced. The game also has this concept where you must play a certain girls route before playing another's, such as you must complete Kotori's route before playing Amane's, which I do not have a problem with since it is the first time I have seen something like this in a visual novel. The characters are all very interesting and their back stories made me care for them, Kotori the grumpy disabled girl, Ageha the childhood friend, Asa the happy twin, Yoru the protective twin, and then Amane, the dedicated airhead. The story is 30-40 hours long, I recommend you look up the VNDB (Visual novel database) entry of the game for more details on the characters and situation. Yes, there is also a restoration back which ads quite a bit more content, so I recommend you get that if you want the complete game. And that's the best I can describe since I don't often write reviews, but purchase this game, it is really fun you will love it!


Amane is best girl.

reviewText:
Alrighty. A review for Kono Oozora ni Tsubasa wo Hirogete/If My Heart Had Wings.
For people new to this sort of game genre, this is a Visual Novel. That means it's text-heavy and is basically like reading a book except there's drawings of landscapes, cute girls, some clouds or something, with added voice-acting and a pretty good soundtrack.

If My Heart Had Wings is a visual novel about Minase Aoi, a dude who was in a bicycle race accident, after which he transfers to a school in his old hometown and meets old friends, new friends, and a glider which changes his life for the better.

Without going into further detail, it's actually a REALLY GOOD visual novel. I'd even say it's better than Katawa Shoujo, but that's my personal opinion (pls don't flame me). The characters are really interesting, the voice acting is SUPERB, and the soundtrack is just a pleasure to listen to. The interface for the game is relatively simple and shouldn't be too hard to navigate. (no, really. i mean you just keep clicking anyway)

What about bad points?

If you're wondering why I'm not talking about the storyline, it's because of MoeNovel. The translation of MoeNovel removes some vital plot points" which makes certain routes in the game not make a lot of sense. However
date: if you do get the restoration patch
recommended: the translation turns out better and all plot is returned to normal. (or if you're just looking for some lewd bits
hoursPlayed:
go on ahead. story's still pretty damn good tho.)

In short:
IMHHW is an amazing visual novel

reviewText: As far as visual novels go I haven't played many but this is definitely one of my favorites, I found myself growing attached to the characters and their stories, desparately hoping that all of their dreams came true! Every single character stands out and are unique in their own way, they all have their own struggles and hardships they wish to overcome, and what they say and how they react to the world around them is a relfection of this. If your looking for something with tons of action, fight scenes or explosions then this is not the game for you. Its a Visual Novel following ordinary people in an ordianry world, who all share one common goal to surpass their human limitations and soar through the heavens!

reviewText: Out of the anime visual novels i've played, this is by far the best. There's just so much story, my playtime exceeded 40 hours because the story changes significantly with different choices. So it's not like you'll be done in 4 hours, you get your money's worth. The premice is pretty unique, it's about a Glider club and the life of those characters, particularly Kotori who is essentially the 'main' non-player character. Art and sound quality are both very good in my opinion, there's even some animated cutscenes, but it's largely all still art shots which of course you can collect.\n\nThe downside is this is the steam version and is missing out significant content because it is 18+ but you are able to patch it in. I also had a few problems with some picture panels freezing for a long time and they end up obscuring the game, that was a bit annoying. Other than that though, very enjoyable.
