reviewText:
Alrighty. A review for Kono Oozora ni Tsubasa wo Hirogete/If My Heart Had Wings.
For people new to this sort of game genre, this is a Visual Novel. That means it's text-heavy and is basically like reading a book except there's drawings of landscapes, cute girls, some clouds or something, with added voice-acting and a pretty good soundtrack.

If My Heart Had Wings is a visual novel about Minase Aoi, a dude who was in a bicycle race accident, after which he transfers to a school in his old hometown and meets old friends, new friends, and a glider which changes his life for the better.

Without going into further detail, it's actually a REALLY GOOD visual novel. I'd even say it's better than Katawa Shoujo, but that's my personal opinion (pls don't flame me). The characters are really interesting, the voice acting is SUPERB, and the soundtrack is just a pleasure to listen to. The interface for the game is relatively simple and shouldn't be too hard to navigate. (no, really. i mean you just keep clicking anyway)

What about bad points?

If you're wondering why I'm not talking about the storyline, it's because of MoeNovel. The translation of MoeNovel removes some vital plot points" which makes certain routes in the game not make a lot of sense. However
date: if you do get the restoration patch
recommended: the translation turns out better and all plot is returned to normal. (or if you're just looking for some lewd bits
hoursPlayed:
go on ahead. story's still pretty damn good tho.)

In short:
IMHHW is an amazing visual novel

reviewText:
Don't care if friends see this review.

If My Heart Had Wings was the second visual novel I ever read, and it's the only one I've re-read multiple times. The visuals, the music, the characters and the story always have me coming back for more. The story, spoiler free, is that of Aoi (lol girl's name) returning to his hometown to find that many things have changed. He takes on a job as the caretaker of an all female dorm and [skipping a bit] gets sexy with lots of waifu material.

I can't say it's my favorite romance story of all time, as the story in each of the 5 routes tends to focus a lot on the state of the glider and everyone's shared dream of reconstructing and flying above a rare natural phenomenon. There's just enough romance to call it a romance game, and yet the relationships seem more real for the fact that it's a by-product of coming together with a shared goal in mind. It doesn't deal with any social issues, nor does it strive to leave some deep message ingrained in your subconscious that is intended to change your life somehow. It's just pure, fun storytelling.

I'm aware of some issues using the (highly recommended) restoration patch on Win8, but it's been solved on Win10.

PROS
-LONG, can spend upwards of 15 hours per route if you listen to all the audio
-Visuals are (mostly) top notch
-Soundtrack (buy it)
-It's a feel-good novel. Minimal tragedy, happy endings
-Duck with tophat
-Tsunderes
-Sexy times, if you download the patch.
-FREQUENTLY ON SALE, Sometimes up to 60% off
-Did I mention the loli twins? (yes, it totally happens)

CONS
-Some minor disply issues with non-background images and motion, relics left (got cockblocked by Hat on my first playthrough, was on screen for 2 different... encounters")
-Not much focus on romance
date: more about Soaring Club narrative\n-Bunch of censored
recommended:
unintelligble Engrish bull spit in the vanilla
-You can't buy it twice

In conclusion. the visuals and soundtrack are 10/10

reviewText: Out of the anime visual novels i've played, this is by far the best. There's just so much story, my playtime exceeded 40 hours because the story changes significantly with different choices. So it's not like you'll be done in 4 hours, you get your money's worth. The premice is pretty unique, it's about a Glider club and the life of those characters, particularly Kotori who is essentially the 'main' non-player character. Art and sound quality are both very good in my opinion, there's even some animated cutscenes, but it's largely all still art shots which of course you can collect.\n\nThe downside is this is the steam version and is missing out significant content because it is 18+ but you are able to patch it in. I also had a few problems with some picture panels freezing for a long time and they end up obscuring the game, that was a bit annoying. Other than that though, very enjoyable.

reviewText:
Although this review will be seen by few, I feel that I need to write it anyway.

If My Had Had Wings is a visual novel, a genre which I've never been a huge fan of. Not because they're not fun, but because it takes a very skilled writer to make one that's worth getting invested in. Yypically those writers stick to writing books because it's far simpler to find a book publisher than it is a team of artists and programmers all working to help make your dream come to life.
This one stands out from the others, however.
The amount of effort put into it to make it immersive, interesting, visually appealing and about anything else you could want is unreal. I'll take it one step at a time.

Visuals - They're more important in this genre than in any other, in my opinion. Stories can be compelling and addicting on their own, but if you're going to throw in artwork, you have to do it well. Otherwise, you end up getting distracted from the story by the game's shortcomings.
The visuals are amazingly done. Hell, the pictures above do better justice than my words. And those aren't edited just to look better or pickings from some concept art, the entire game looks like that, The art style is very consistant and honestly it makes the world the game presents feel even more real.

Audio - I actually didn't expect this game to have full voice acting. That's a huge task, but it's done, at least in Japanese. It seriously helps add to the emotions of everything and while in some visual novels I find myself quickly skipping through text just to get through; in this game I find myself replaying some lines of dialog just to hear them again. I don't speak the language, but the acting is very good. Good enough to make me wait until they've finished speaking to click.
The music is just as impressive, and I've actually been listening to the soundtrack outside of the game. Although I have no connection to this music, some of the songs seriously bring up feelings of nostalgia for me. Perhaps it's just the way they sound, or maybe I'm connecting them to something without knowing. All I know is that the music adds so much to the emotion of scenes that I can't help but get teary-eyed at times.

Story - You be noticing me using the word emotion" a lot in this and there's a reason. Emotion is something this game has that very few games ever have for me. You get so invested into the characters
hoursPlayed: sometimes even knowing exactly how they'll react to something. I find myself verbally responding to many things they say even though there's nobody listening and reacting emotionally just as often.\nIt's lengthy for sure
voteText: and has plenty of choices
helpfulPercent: but that only makes it better to me.\n\nThis is the first game that has made me feel nostalgic towards time I spent with the characters since I got Kingdom Hearts the Christmas it came out. Most of the time when I play games I want to get 100% completion and I'm always thinking about how I could best do it or I'm just killing time
votesHelpful: but not this one. When I play this game
votesTotal: I feel like I'm holding a work of art in my hands. Something that someone else has so carefully crafted to give that exact feelings
votesFunny: to work it's way into your heart the way some  other form of story has done at some point in your life. For me

reviewText:
A touching story about wanting to fly. Hopes and dreams riding on homemade wing.
It took me about 14 hours to read what i think is the first half of the story (The first section anyway) and loved every line.
The amazing soundtrack helps set the atmosphere perfectly and the Japanese voice acting helps you understand the character even if you can't understand it. (p.s. you can listen to the music in the gallery once you hear the songs)
A few minor translation errors but I couldn't care less.
Every highly recommended.
I can only hope that they release english versions of the other two side stories.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Who needs achievements and trading cards when you have glorious H scenes! If you're going to invest time in this I must recommend installing the restoration patch nad the sweet love UI. (Kotori best girl BTW)

Tears were shed and feels were felt throughtout all of the routes (Thank the lord for the restoration patch.) Without the restoration patch the novel is a complete mess and time shouldn't be invested in it the translations were off a lot of the times and the grammar and spelling, oh god, Moenovel's english was more engrish; it was a chore to figure out what they were trying to say. (I'm looking at you redone Ageha route)

However, I must commend Moenovel for trying to bring Visual novels to the west to enjoy and hopefully this will be start of more Visual novels being traslated in english for the world to enjoy.

Music in this was top notch everything felt in place. The BGM allowed you to read the text easily and peacefully and the music really set the tone for serious and less serious scenes. All the main characters were all developed very well in their respective routes and made you really care for them. Their development made them seem extreamly realistic once you get further and further into their routes. The art was really, really good! I was really suprised everyone had unique designs and the detail for backgorund art was really extraordinary. The facial expressions for each character really fitted their personalities well and the huge variety of expressions made it so it was fresh to look at hem even though you seen them before.

All in all, I wouldn't recommend the Moenovel version, however the restored version is something to be marveled at. A heart moving tale that drags you deeper and deeper to care for the characters and make you realise once you finished a route how lonely you actaully are. ;_;

No waifu, no laifu. If you don't feel your heart churning at least once while reading this visual novel you're probably doing it wrong.

reviewText:
I strongly recommend this visual novel however; in this steam version there is heavy censorship with all sexual jokes and references removed but, you're not all here for that and even if you are, there are ways to restore the game to its original state.

The first and foremost thing to mention about this game is the fantastically touching story about some of the characters. Obviously some of the routes are better written than others (looking at you, whoever translated Ageha's route) but my personal favourite was Kotori's route closely followed by Amane's. Every single character in the main cast has had some sort of significant loss in their past, perhaps even traumatic. And seeing as the main character has had a rather hefty loss himself, Aoi is able to connect on a very strong level with each and every one of these girls. But, for all you people who just got very excited; no, there is no harem ending. Anyway, as the story goes on you encounter more hardships and emotions are evoked several times along the way as the reader. Emotionally evoking stories are often a good read in my opinion.

The music is good in this game, but nothing to write home about. You will probably think of it as really good after you've completed the stories but then after a while you realise that you only feel that way because you're being reminded of certain scenes and dialogues that you liked in the story. That isn't necessarily a bad thing, but to repeat myself, the music isn't top notch, but visual novels aren't about the music.

The characters themselves are horrifically stereotypical. The moody handicapped person, the childhood friend, the mysterious senpai, the ditsy twin and the intelligent twin, however; they manage to make it all work. These characters, despite all conforming to stereotpyes actually work and you do get easily emotionally attached to them through the stories.

The artwork is nice, but again, nothing to write home about. Combined with the music there is a nice atmosphere in the game.

There are a number of decisions to make over the course of this long story which is important to some people. I couldn't care less.

Overall, fantastic story, really good characters despite all being stereotypical, decent artwork and music but nothing spectacular about either - a very good visual novel which is going to be retranslated. Hopefully this time around large chunks of Ageha's route aren't an incomprensible mess.

reviewText:
This game will break your emotions in multiple different directions in different parts of the novel. You'll smile, laugh, cringe and cry. It's all here.

Now there's one problem, without patches and fixes, some of the lines are missing and some translations are not good.

I still recommend this game to any one who has a decent amount of spare time and loves a good visual novel. 10/10

If my Heart Had Wings is a visual novel with deep story and lots of detail, its not all about seeing anime boobs and focuse on a good love story with many diffrent endings, personal I would of liked some more choices but I would give this game a solid 9/10.

* Lots of story endings
* Very detailed
* Amazing music

Con's -

* No sexual scenes, which for some people will love but for me I would of liked some 18+ scencs, nothing crazy of course ;P

Overall after finishing every story line, with about 35 hours played to do so, with about 5 hours of idel, I can say this visal novel is vell worth your money if you love good story and a detailed plot.

voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Are you chasing a dream? Or are you helping another along to their dream? Why do you do that? These are the main themes that I found in If My Heart Had Wings.

I would recommend this visual novel as a good starter to see whether you might like the genre or not, especially the part that involves sitting and reading for long periods of time. It has a good soundtrack and I still listen to a couple of the tracks every now and then. The story, characters and artwork are decent. There is nothing that blows the mind or makes the jaw drop, but they fit together well and make the visual novel enjoyable. There are few decision points and many save slots to help getting used to how to play a visual novel.

There is one issue that stops me making this a strong recommendation – the translation. The translation either wasn’t quality checked or the quality check was very poor. I had to really focus to keep track of the story around the badly translated parts. The story log really helps in that respect.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
A really delightful game that connects you with the characters on a level that I haven't ever experienced before.

With most games that have you picking between different choices, you might expect that your choices do next to nothing and you are left with perhaps just a few different lines and graphics to look at. Let me tell you this is not the case! As you progress your relationship with your chosen girl the story starts to develop based around that character and the story changes to suit what partner you chose, which really adds to the replayability of the game. Considering how likeable the characters are you will want to go through every route you can, which is exactly what I did.

I was new to visual novels completely and I can wholeheartedly say purchasing this will have you not wanting to return to real life, it is that great! As other reviews have most likely mentioned, the restoration patch is a must for myself and I do recommend it to anyone who purchases the game. I am not even particularly interested in the hentai itself and found myself skipping over those scenes when I feel they didn't add much to character progression. I just enjoyed using the patch as not only is a lot of translation errors fixed, the many scenes that were cut are added again and the sexual innuendos had me laughing.

Overall an incredibly heartwarming story. Not going to lie I cried whilst reading this visual novel. Would highly recommend to everyone! 10/10
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Alrighty. A review for Kono Oozora ni Tsubasa wo Hirogete/If My Heart Had Wings.
For people new to this sort of game genre, this is a Visual Novel. That means it's text-heavy and is basically like reading a book except there's drawings of landscapes, cute girls, some clouds or something, with added voice-acting and a pretty good soundtrack.

If My Heart Had Wings is a visual novel about Minase Aoi, a dude who was in a bicycle race accident, after which he transfers to a school in his old hometown and meets old friends, new friends, and a glider which changes his life for the better.

Without going into further detail, it's actually a REALLY GOOD visual novel. I'd even say it's better than Katawa Shoujo, but that's my personal opinion (pls don't flame me). The characters are really interesting, the voice acting is SUPERB, and the soundtrack is just a pleasure to listen to. The interface for the game is relatively simple and shouldn't be too hard to navigate. (no, really. i mean you just keep clicking anyway)

What about bad points?

If you're wondering why I'm not talking about the storyline, it's because of MoeNovel. The translation of MoeNovel removes some vital plot points" which makes certain routes in the game not make a lot of sense. However
date: if you do get the restoration patch
recommended: the translation turns out better and all plot is returned to normal. (or if you're just looking for some lewd bits
hoursPlayed:
go on ahead. story's still pretty damn good tho.)

In short:
IMHHW is an amazing visual novel
voteText: if you include the patch. If you can get it on sale
helpfulPercent: highly recommended.\nIf you're also looking for a good story-based experience but don't want to read a book
votesHelpful:
this is the game for you.
[even though it's pretty much a book]
Verdict: Solid 8.8/10. This is an amazing game. Get it.
Also: Duck wearing a hat as a supporting character. Pretty good feature if you ask me.
PS. kotori best girl fite me"

reviewText: I've recently started this game and I'm instantly hooked! I'm probably a rare breed, for finding visual novels which doesn't emphasize primarily on sex is what I look for in VNs. Steam has many VNs, but a lot of them focus on sex and vulgarity. This VN on the other hand emphasises more on the story, character development, and romance in a good way. I know this sounds pretty weird, but I've always wanted something similar to 'Angel Beats', the anime, and this is probably pretty close to it. Like I said before, I just started so maybe this review will change, but as of right now it is very calming and pleasant. I've heard there is a patch where they uncensor parts of the story to make it more sexually perverted, so just promise me to play your first walkthrough without it. Enjoy the story and characters first.

reviewText:
Firstly, please ignore my massive playtime -- it's mostly a result of leaving the game up for weeks on end and never closing it.

However, I've now completed three of the six storyline variants, and I can say with certainty that this game is not only an excellent and rewarding story of friendship and dream-chasing, but also has TREMENDOUS replay value. Each time you go through with different options, the first and second acts are more or less similar with a few differing scenes, but from that point onward it's completely different. I was totally shocked to see what a difference there was. I can't wait to finish the rest of the story routes.

Absolutely adore this game. 12/10, highly, highly recommend it.

reviewText:
Just finished the main character - Kotori route. Let me tell you, it is GOD DAMN GLORGIOUS. The music, op, ending, etc.
The only thing I have to say is the middle of the story can get a bit boring depend on your interest. If so, really welcome to install the 18+ patch if you want to, unlike other adult visual novel, the h-scenes are pretty heartwarming.

Buy this if you:
+ Like planes or glider
+ Like Anime
+ Like Visual novel
+ Fine with reading
+ Want to finish all the routes because all the characters are so FREAKEN LOVABLE.
+ Love Japanese
+ Love romantic stories
+ Easy and simple route choice
- Able to connect to the internet and use dictionery
- Good at playing scramble words
- Can withstand the 50~ hours reading
- A bit complicated way to install 18+ patch.
- Can't complete the Archements if you installed 18+ patch.


TL;DR:
Besides a bit of grammer problems, this one is definitely not worse than other visual novel in terms of story. If you like glider or romantic story, BUY IT!!!
